items.title: South Australia announces $674 million response to domestic violence investigation
items.summary: The Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual violence in South Australia was sparked by the deaths of four women in a week.

items.title: Health ministers reject federal hospital funding offer as 3,000 older patients remain stranded
items.summary: Health ministers said the door was still open for negotiations after meeting with federal Health Minister Mark Butler on Friday.

items.title: Dark, wet and 'scary': Nobel Peace Prize winner's secret sea escape from Venezuela
items.summary: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado emerged in Norway after missing her award ceremony.

items.title: Anthony Albanese confirms deal to keep major aluminium smelter open
items.summary: The Tomago smelter will continue to operate under an arrangement announced by the federal government.

items.title: 'Extortionate': Why fans are calling for an 'immediate halt' to FIFA World Cup ticket sales
items.summary: A fan group has sharply criticised the "astronomical" cost of tickets to next year's event.

items.title: 'Clear message': Eurovision winner Nemo returns trophy over Israel’s 2026 participation
items.summary: Swiss singer Nemo, winner of the 2024 contest and the first openly non-binary champion, announced they will return their trophy in protest.

items.title: Time magazine names 'Architects of AI' as Person of the Year. Here's who's pictured
items.summary: The cover includes Mark Zuckerberg, Elon Musk and Sam Altman, among others.

items.title: Twenty years on from the Cronulla riots, how have racial tensions in Australia changed?
items.summary: The Cronulla riots prompted a national reckoning on racism. How have things changed in the two decades since?

items.title: Zelenskyy outlines 'key points of disagreement' after Kyiv hands peace plan back to US
items.summary: The wartime president said Ukrainians would have the final say on any territorial concessions, "whether through elections or a referendum".

items.title: Thai PM moves to dissolve parliament as border clashes with Cambodia continue
items.summary: Prime minister Anutin Charnvirakul said the move would not impact Thailand's military operations along the frontier.

items.title: 'Is this actually helping?' How Trump's tourist disclosure plan would affect Australians
items.summary: The US appears to be cracking down on speech criticising the government but experts say Australians may not have much to worry about.

items.title: 'Profoundly distressing milestone': Indigenous deaths in custody highest in 45 years
items.summary: Grim figures reveal 33 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people died in custody in 2024-25 — the highest number since 1980.

items.title: 'Repugnant' text messages highlighted in NT's appeal of fatal hit-and-run sentence
items.summary: The case of a driver who received a 12-month community corrections order for a fatal hit-and-run is back before the courts.

items.title: My brother lived without an autism diagnosis for four decades. I wish it came sooner
items.summary: For most of his life, Helen’s brother John didn’t know he was autistic. He was diagnosed in the 1970s — a time of limited understanding of neurodiversity.

items.title: New jab for new COVID-19 variant: Australians can now access additional vaccine
items.summary: The federal health department says regular COVID-19 vaccinations are "the best way" to maintain protection.

items.title: Venezuela condemns 'blatant theft' after US seizes tanker and Trump pledges further action
items.summary: The seizure marks an escalation in tensions in the region, where a large US military presence has built up in recent weeks.

items.title: Porridge is a way of life in this Scottish town. An Australian helped capture it on film
items.summary: This tiny Scottish town is home to the World Porridge Making Championships. An Australian documentary has unearthed what it takes to be the best of the best.

items.title: US could ask Australian tourists to submit five years of social media history
items.summary: The proposal would expand existing Electronic System for Travel Authorisation requirements to include personal data spanning years.

items.title: From Calibri to Times New Roman: Why the US state department changed its font again
items.summary: The US state department started using Calibri, a modern sans-serif font that is more accessible for people with disabilities, during the Biden administration in January 2023.

items.title: Evidence reveals humans started fire-making 400,000 years ago after landmark UK find
items.summary: The discovery pushes back global fire-making timelines and suggests our ancestors transported materials, such as iron pyrite, to spark flames.

items.title: 'Impossible problem': The retirees who may need an extra $300k in super
items.summary: Some people will have to save 1.5 times more than others to have a 'dignified retirement', according to a new analysis

items.title: Australia’s teen social media ban: How day one unfolded — and the world’s response
items.summary: A year after clearing parliament, the teen social media ban finally took effect. But its debut was not without issues.

items.title: Crocodiles v humans: Safety crackdown could backfire, environmentalist says
items.summary: Expansions to crocodile removal zones and increased patrols are part of a plan to increase public safety.

items.title: The simple question at hospital that saved Stuart's life
items.summary: A new national report has found that Australians are facing an average five-year wait for life-saving medical technologies.
